intro: Eryngium babadaghense, commonly known as the Babadagh thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the high-altitude regions of Turkey. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny, blue-green foliage and purple-pink flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are tubular and arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. Eryngium babadaghense is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
